Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2015 02:06PM MariaGrazia wrote: Hello! So I have a suspicious lymph node that they want to keep an eye on. Apparently they can see it in my breast? They don't see any cancer, but another doctor will be looking at the tests to confirm. I have to go back in 6 months for a follow up to make sure it does not get larger. So PHEW! But I will NOT skip my mammo's any more and will be there in 6 months with smiles on my face.
Posts.Title: Very Nervous, Going for Diagonstic Mammo & Ultrasound Tomorrow MariaGrazia greenwillow3

Posts.Content: MariaGrazia wrote: I'm a bit nervous. I went for a routine mammo last week (bad me, haven't gone regularly) and they called me the next day and told me I had to come back as soon as possible for diagnostic mammo (found out in the letter I received a few days later it included an ultrasound). So I check the breast, and no I didn't do regular exams either because I never could figure out what I was looking for, and find a grape size lump. Now I know I shouldn't be nervous as most of the time these things are just cysts. BUT, my grandmother had breast cancer and last year I had to have 1/2 my thyroid removed for an inconclusive lump that just happens to be the same side as the breast in question. I go tomorrow and I know they'll give me results immediately, but I'm concerned. I haven't really told anyone cause I don't want to panic them, my husband knows and 2 friends. Hoping it's nothing.
